entries.title: West Virginia’s Republican Governor Is ‘Leaning’ Toward a Senate Run
entries.description: West Virginia Governor Jim Justice, a Republican, expressed a keen interest in running for the state’s Senate seat now held by moderate Democrat Joe Manchin.

entries.title: Senator Feinstein Keeps Everyone Guessing on Whether She’ll Run Again in California
entries.description: US Senator Dianne Feinstein said she’ll announce this spring whether she will seek reelection to a seventh term even as fellow California Democrats announce plans to compete for the seat.

entries.title: Tyre Nichols’s Killing Leads Senators to Rethink Policing Talks
entries.description: The Jan. 7 fatal beating of Tyre Nichols at the hands of Memphis police officers has led senators in both parties to consider restarting stalled talks on an overhaul of US policing practices.

entries.title: New Jersey Concealed-Carry Gun Restrictions Blocked By Federal Judge
entries.description: A federal judge in New Jersey blocked a state law restricting the carrying of concealed firearms in parks, restaurants, bars and other public places from going into effect.

entries.title: White House to End Covid-19 Emergency Declarations On May 11
entries.description: The White House will wind down a pair of Covid-19 emergency declarations on May 11, the administration said on Monday.

entries.title: Bolsonaro Has No Intention of Cutting His Stay in Florida Short
entries.description: Brazil’s former president Jair Bolsonaro is in no rush to leave Florida, making life deeply uncomfortable for the White House as it gets ready to welcome his successor and bitter rival next month.

entries.title: Medicare Wants to Claw Back $4.7 Billion From Private Health Insurers
entries.description: The US Medicare agency will seek about $4.7 billion over 10 years in clawback payments from private insurers that manage its programs under a long-awaited rule finalized Monday, a blow to the industry that sets up a likely court fight.

entries.title: Trump Sues Journalist Bob Woodward for Releasing Interview Recordings
entries.description: Former President Donald Trump is suing journalist Bob Woodward for releasing recordings of interviews that he gave to the journalist in 2019 and 2020, claiming he never agreed to those tapes being shared with the public.

entries.title: Biden Team Weighs Fully Cutting Off Huawei From US Suppliers
entries.description: The Biden administration is considering cutting off Huawei Technologies Co. from all of its American suppliers, including Intel Corp. and Qualcomm Inc., as the US government intensifies a crackdown on the Chinese technology sector.

entries.title: Mexico Rules Out Profit-Sharing Tax Reduction for Pemex in 2024
entries.description: Gabriel Yorio, Mexico's deputy finance minister, speaks during an interview in Mexico City, Mexico, on Thursday, Sept. 12, 2019. Mexico's Finance Ministry isn't considering an explicit guarantee on the bonds of state-owned Petroleos Mexicanos despite increasing costs of issuing them because it could hurt the country's own debt standings, according to a top official. Photographer: Jacky Muniello/Bloomberg

entries.title: Trump Secures Second Extension on Financial Asset Disclosure
entries.description: Former President Donald Trump — fresh off a weekend campaign appearance where he said he’s “more committed” than ever in his third bid for the White House — was given a second 45-day extension to file his financial disclosure form with the Federal Election Commission.

entries.title: Trump Role in Hush Money Payments to Be Probed by Grand Jury
entries.description: Manhattan District Attorney Alvin Bragg is starting a grand jury investigation of any role former President Donald Trump may have played in making hush money payments to a porn star during his 2016 campaign, according to a person familiar with the matter.

entries.title: Trump Used Records Requests to Get Look Behind Scenes of Talks Over His Taxes
entries.description: Donald Trump demanded reams of information from the Internal Revenue Service as it was preparing to turn over his personal tax returns to a congressional committee, papering the agency with a deluge of Freedom of Information Act requests in search of a behind-the scenes look at its deliberations, new documents show.

entries.title: Trump 2016 Campaign NDA Settlement Can’t Be Kept Secret, Judge Says
entries.description: Former President Donald Trump’s 2016 campaign must disclose the amount of money it would pay to settle a long-running court fight with a former staffer over its nondisclosure agreements, if it wants to go ahead with the deal, a judge ruled.

entries.title: FAA Adds Safeguards to US Flight System to Prevent New Outages
entries.description: The US government has added new protections to the aviation notice system that led to thousands of disruptions earlier this month in an attempt to prevent such failures in the future, the Federal Aviation Administration told lawmakers.

entries.title: Violent Chaos Has Cost Peruvian Farms $300 Million in Lost Exports
entries.description: In bad news for fruit consumers, exporting powerhouse Peru has lost about $300 million in farm shipments during eight weeks of violent turmoil, according to the nation’s agricultural association.

entries.title: How Israel and Iran Attack Each Other While Avoiding All-Out War
entries.description: Of the many conflicts in the Middle East, the one between Iran and Israel is the most potentially explosive. Iranian leaders periodically vow to annihilate Israel and are suspected of pursuing nuclear weapons that would back the threat. Israel, which is thought to have such arms, has committed to doing whatever it takes to prevent Iran from acquiring them. For years, the two have engaged in a shadow war, quietly attacking each other ­on land, by air and at sea, in some cases by proxy. They have

entries.title: South Africa Considers National State of Disaster for Energy Crisis
entries.description: South Africa is considering declaring a national state of disaster as record power cuts cripple the economy.

entries.title: Eastern EU Nations Ask Bloc For Help as Ukrainian Grain Floods Nearby Markets
entries.description: A group of European Union countries urged the bloc to act to help alleviate the oversupply of grain as cheap imports from Ukraine flood markets in neighboring countries, cutting demand for local produce and triggering protests from farmers.

entries.title: New Metro-North Rail Service to Penn Station Postponed by Seven Months
entries.description: A $2.9 billion project to extend Metro-North Railroad service into New York City’s Penn Station has been delayed by about seven months, Metropolitan Transportation Authority officials said Monday.

entries.title: Germany Says Commission Hasn’t Heard Its Concerns on EU Rules
entries.description: Christian Lindner

entries.title: UK Firefighters to Strike Over Pay, First Time in 20 Years
entries.description: UK firefighters voted to strike over pay and conditions, adding to a snowballing wave of industrial unrest that’s swept through the British workforce.

entries.title: Pandemic Had a Lasting Impact on Children’s Learning, Study Finds
entries.description: Children’s learning progress slowed during the pandemic even after strict curbs were lifted, with deficits persisting into the middle of last year, according to a study that raises questions about Covid’s lasting impact on an entire generation.

entries.title: France Braces for More Transport Chaos as Reforms Prompt Strikes
entries.description: France is bracing for another wave of strikes that will affect flights, trains and public transport as labor unions continue their protests against the government’s proposed pension reform.

entries.title: Czech President-Elect Calls Taiwan’s Leader to Bolster Ties
entries.description: The Czech Republic’s incoming president, Petr Pavel, spoke with Taiwanese leader Tsai Ing-wen two days after he was elected, a clear sign the new leader plans to bolster ties in the face of mounting pressure from China.

entries.title: President Ramaphosa’s Deputy Set to Go in South African Cabinet Revamp
entries.description: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa is contemplating changes to his cabinet as public anger mounts over record power outages, shoddy government services, rampant poverty and high unemployment, with his deputy David Mabuza among those in danger of losing their jobs.

entries.title: Netanyahu Invokes Goldman Sachs and JPMorgan in Economic Defense
entries.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has invoked Wall Street investment banks Goldman Sachs Group Inc. and JPMorgan Chase & Co. to rebuff warnings of a market backlash against his government’s plans to reshape the judiciary.

entries.title: Putin and Saudi Crown Prince Discuss OPEC+ Cooperation
entries.description: Russia’s President Vladimir Putin and Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman talked about OPEC+ by phone ahead of the alliance’s committee meeting on Wednesday.

entries.title: Finland Puts Positive Spin on Turkey’s NATO Ratification Remarks
entries.description: Comments by Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan that his country may ratify Finland’s bid to join NATO present a “positive sign,” the Nordic nation’s foreign minister said.

entries.title: Power Crisis Triggers Water Cuts in South Africa’s Economic Hub
entries.description: Parts of Johannesburg, South Africa’s economic hub, are being subjected to renewed water-supply cuts as ongoing electricity shortages disrupt pumping operations.

entries.title: Malaysia PM Anwar Tells Goldman to Pay Up on 1MDB Settlement
entries.description: Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim demanded that Goldman Sachs Group Inc. honor its settlement with the government for its role in the 1MDB scandal, saying the Wall Street firm shouldn’t use its financial strength to dictate terms.

entries.title: From ‘the Coin’ to High-Interest Bonds, the US’s Debt-Limit Options Aren’t Great
entries.description: If lawmakers fail to either raise or suspend the US government’s statutory borrowing limit, President Joe Biden and Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen will have to get creative.

entries.title: Russia’s Oil Cargoes Surge With Pipe Down and Fuel Ban at Hand
entries.description: Four-week average flows of Russian crude highest since June with new EU curbs looming

entries.title: TikTok CEO to Testify in Congress on Privacy, Kids’ Access
entries.description: TikTok CEO Shou Zi Chew will testify before the House Energy and Commerce Committee on the company’s privacy policies, the app’s impact on children and the company’s relationship with the Communist Party in China, Chair Cathy McMorris Rodgers said in a statement.

entries.title: At Least 28 Killed, Scores Injured in Pakistan Mosque Blast
entries.description: At least 28 people were killed and more than 100 others wounded in a bomb blast at a mosque in a security compound in northwestern Pakistan, officials said. It was the worst such attack in almost 11 months.

entries.title: Israel Faces Identity Crisis As Violence Rages
entries.description: A deadly attack on Israelis near a synagogue on the weekend has capped off one of the bloodiest months in Israel and the occupied West Bank in years.

entries.title: Sunak Says UK Can’t Raise Taxes to End Dispute With Nurses
entries.description: Prime Minister Rishi Sunak said he cannot raise UK taxes to fund pay rises for workers in the state-run National Health Service.

entries.title: Erdogan Rivals Vow to Make Turkish Central Bank Independent
entries.description: Turkey’s opposition parties said they would ensure an “independent” central bank that would focus on curbing rampant inflation if they defeat President Recep Tayyip Erdogan’s party in May elections.

entries.title: Emhoff Urges ‘Bold Action’ From US, Europe to Fight Antisemitism
entries.description: During a visit to Poland and Germany scheduled to coincide with International Holocaust Remembrance day on Jan. 27, Second Gentleman Doug Emhoff said governments around the world must take immediate action to fight rising antisemitism.

entries.title: China Urges Kevin McCarthy Not to Repeat Pelosi Visit to Taiwan
entries.description: China called on US House Speaker Kevin McCarthy not to visit Taiwan, raising the specter of a repeat of the showdown last year when his predecessor, Nancy Pelosi, made her own trip to the democratically run island.

entries.title: Biden to Kick Off Work to Relieve East Coast Amtrak Bottleneck
entries.description: President Joe Biden on Monday will help kick off a project to replace a 150-year-old rail tunnel in Baltimore that is seen as among the worst bottlenecks slowing train traffic on the Northeast Corridor.

entries.title: Malaysia’s Anwar Vows Gradual Debt Reduction to Ensure Stability
entries.description: Malaysia’s Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim said his government will work to gradually lower the nation’s debt and narrow the budget gap, without resorting to raising taxes that hurt the poor.

entries.title: China 2022 Budget Deficit Widens to Record 8.96 Trillion Yuan
entries.description: China’s broad budget deficit has widened to a record of 8.96 trillion yuan in 2022, according to a statement released by the Ministry of Finance.

entries.title: China Dismisses US Claims of Support for Russia as ‘Paranoia’
entries.description: China hit back at a report that the US has confronted it with evidence suggesting some of its state-owned firms may be helping Russia’s war in Ukraine, saying Washington should stop sending weapons if it wants the conflict to end.

entries.title: China Says No New Covid Variant Found in Lunar New Year Holiday
entries.description: China has yet to detect any new Covid mutations during the seven-day Spring Festival holiday that ended Friday, Chen Cao, a researcher at the Chinese Center for Disease Control and Prevention, says at a briefing.

entries.title: Food Blogger Who Cooked and Ate Great White Shark Is Fined $18,500
entries.description: A food blogger in China was fined 125,000 yuan ($18,500) by authorities after she posted a video showing her illegally buying and eating a great white shark, a clip that prompted a backlash online.

entries.title: Azerbaijan Closes Embassy in Iran Amid Tensions Over Gun Attack
entries.description: Azerbaijan closed its embassy in Tehran and evacuated the staff and their families amid spiraling tensions after a gunman stormed the diplomatic mission, killing the security chief and wounding two other guards.

entries.title: Adani Labels Fight With US Short Seller as Attack on India
entries.description: The Adani Group has cast its brawl with a US short seller as an attack on India and the issue could overshadow parliament’s budget session with opposition lawmakers highlighting the ties between Asia’s richest man and Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

entries.title: NZ’s Hipkins Boosts Chances of Labour at Election, Poll Shows
entries.description: New Zealand’s new Prime Minister Chris Hipkins has boosted his party’s chances at this year’s election, with a poll showing him neck-and-neck with his opponents less than eight months out from the ballot.

entries.title: China Presses Students to Head Back to Overseas Universities
entries.description: China’s government told students pursuing degrees at foreign universities that it’s time to get back to class, another sign that life in the world’s second-biggest economy is returning to normal after three years of harsh Covid Zero rules.

entries.title: Turkish Opposition to Reveal Presidential Candidate Mid-February
entries.description: Turkey’s six-party opposition will select its candidate to run against President Recep Tayyip Erdogan on February 13, CHP leader Kemal Kilicdaroglu said.

entries.title: Pakistan Rupee Slides to New Record Low Ahead of IMF Loan Talks
entries.description: Pakistan’s rupee slumped to a fresh record ahead of a visit by the International Monetary Fund team for negotiations over the resumption of its $6.5 billion bailout program.

entries.title: Putin's Oil Makes a Stop Off Spain en Route to China
entries.description: Sanctions are making it riskier and pricier for the Kremlin’s crude to get to Asia, but the EU is still a transit hub.

entries.title: Macron Digs In as Hostility to French Pension Reform Mushrooms
entries.description: Opposition to Emmanuel Macron’s plan to raise the retirement age is swelling, in a test of the French leader’s determination to pursue a signature step in his pro-business revamp of the French economy.

entries.title: More African Nations Are Expected to Tap the G-20’s Debt-Restructuring Plan
entries.description: More African countries are expected to join Chad, Zambia, Ethiopia and Ghana in seeking to restructure debts under the Group-of-20 nations’ so-called Common Framework, the head of a United Nations panel said.

entries.title: Peru Protests Put Huge China-Owned Copper Mine on Brink of Halt
entries.description: One of Peru’s biggest copper mines will stop production Wednesday if transport disruptions linked to nationwide political unrest don’t end, according to its owner MMG Ltd.

entries.title: Japan PM Kishida Faces Calls for Election Over Defense Tax Hike
entries.description: Japanese voters want an election before any hike in taxes to fund Prime Minister Fumio Kishida’s plans for a record increase in defense spending and providing more support for families with children, according to two polls.

entries.title: Ukraine Latest: Russian Missile Hit on Kharkiv Building Reported
entries.description: A suspected Russian surface-to-air missile slammed into a residential building in Kharkiv, causing a fire and casualties, the city’s mayor said. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy urged allies to provide long-range missiles and his defense minister made a plea for aircraft.

entries.title: Putin Threatened to Kill Me With a Missile, Says Johnson
entries.description: Boris Johnson has claimed that Vladimir Putin told him "I don't want to hurt you, but with a missile, it would only take a minute", in a call ahead of the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

entries.title: Sunak Turns Attentions to Fixing UK’s NHS After Zahawi Debacle
entries.description: Rishi Sunak will attempt to get his UK premiership back on track Monday with a plan to overhaul the crisis-hit National Health Service, after dramatically firing Conservative Party Chairman Nadhim Zahawi over his tax affairs following weeks of damaging headlines.

entries.title: North Korea Could Get a Vital Lifeline From Arms Sales to Russia
entries.description: Artillery is one thing the impoverished Asian state has in abundance
